page.title: 05LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: Many people are under the mistaken impression that because it is a 'New Town' that Basildon has no historical background,no roots,no identity. This is far from the truth. The name Basildon itself is of Saxon origin and means 'Beorhtels Hill'. In the first Domesday Book survey in 1086 it is shown as Belesduna or Bertesduna. certain land-owning families are mentioned in the earlier historical records. The Town Centreis built around what was the site of Barstable Hall;this manor-house was once held by Odo Bishop of Bayeux and half brother to William the Conqueror. During the building of roads and houses, much evidence of links with the past were discovered.
